content.body:
It's a sub-heading, having a list of sections each with its own subheading kind of makes sense to me as one of the rationales: ```

Page Heading

1.

Section Heading\

Stuff

2.

Other section heading

Stuff

``` Not sure about the history etc.
content.formatted_body:
It's a sub-heading, having a list of sections each with its own subheading kind of makes sense to me as one of the rationales:

<h1>Page Heading</h1>
1. <h2>Section Heading\</h2>
    <p>Stuff</p>


2. <h2>Other section heading</h2>
 <p>Stuff</p>

Not sure about the history etc.

content.formatted_body:
In reply to @ryushin0:matrix.org
Hello. Is it correct to ask a question here about HTML? If that's true, I have a question for you.

I'm curious as to the rationale for including the <h2> tag inside the <li> tag.

Thanks in advance for your reply.
 *

It's a sub-heading, having a list of sections each with its own subheading kind of makes sense to me as one of the rationales:

\<h1>Page Heading\</h1>
1. \<h2>Section Heading\</h2>
    \<p>Stuff\</p>


2. \<h2>Other section heading\</h2>
 \<p>Stuff\</p>

Not sure about the history etc.
